Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Amathus
Curator's comments: For other examples of scarabs from Amathus, including many with archaeological contexts, see Forgeau 1986 (from which the present example is omitted on p. 157 where the other scarabs from this tomb are discussed) and Clerc 1991. Clerc et al. 1976 discuss contextualised examples from cultic contexts in Kition. Forgeau (171-6) and Lagarce (in Clerc et al. 1976, 167-74) provide useful overviews of the use and significance of scarabs (along with other Egyptianizing amulets) on Cyprus which often differ from those found in Egyptian contexts. Bibliography: Forgeau A. 1986, 'Scarabées, scaraboïdes et cônes', in R. Laffineur et al., Amathonte III. Testimonia 3 (Paris), 135-176. Clerc G. 1991, 'Aegyptiaca', in eds V. Karageorghis et al., La nécrople d'Amathonte Tombes 110-385. V (Nicosia), 1-50. Clerc G. et al. 1976, Fouilles de Kition. II. Objets égyptiens et égyptisants (Nicosia).
